Uchen-faithful
lichen, akind of vegetation, clings tightly to the surface of trees and
rocks on which it grows* The term lichen-faithful describes an embrace
which is too encompassing, too close, and ultimately fatal*
the sun beats lightning
Ohe brilliance of the sun’s rays, glancing in reflections off the moving
surfaces of the waves, suggests lightning flashes.
treble
A musical term referring to the highest part, the soprano part, in
harmonized music. Its use here suggests the music of the children’s
happy excited voices heard against the deeper background sound of the
waves washing onto the beach.
urchirg
The connotation is a double one in the poem: sea-urchins, mollusks that
live ±a almost unconsciously in the sea, and the mischievous boys
playing on the shore, are unaware of the real power of the sea.
■waves fold thunder
like the image of lightning struck from the waves, this image suggests
the combination of sky and sea. As the waves roll onto the shore, the
resulting roar suggests the sound of thunder*
